oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Double barrel shotgun of John Henry Bradberry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Henry Bradberry served as a corporal in Co. K, 6th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA and enlisted at Dresden, Tenn. He served as the company cook in 1865. Bradberry owned this civilian shotgun which dates from the 1850 to 1870 time period. It is unlikely that he used this weapon in the Union army but may have used it for protection from pro-Confederates before or after his enlistment. Bradberry lived from 1833-1911 in Weakley County, Tennessee.
